body_html:
Thanks Asim!

I like the idea of fewer public symbols, however, I am not sure whether cosine_decay should default to having restarts enabled or disabled. The warm restarts idea was a big contribution of the original paper, but I kind of preferred the simplicity of removing hyperparameters that cosine_decay currently has. I figured having two public APIs, one simple, one complex might be preferred.

Similarly, with linear_cosine_decay, etc; if we add num_periods and beta and other fields to cosine_decay, the documentation and code gets more complicated, and I thought it might make sense to keep things simple.

What do you all think?
